Tras la invasión de Holanda, los Frank, comerciantes judíos alemanes  emigrados a Amsterdam en 1933, se ocultaron de la Gestapo en una  buhardilla anexa al edificio donde el padre de Anne tenía sus oficinas.  Eran ocho personas y permanecieron recluidas desde junio de 1942 hasta  agosto de 1944, fecha en que fueron detenidas y enviadas a campos de concentración. En ese lugar y en las más precarias condiciones, Anne, a la sazón una niña de trece años, escribió su estremecedor Diario:  un testimonio único en su género sobre el horror y la barbarie nazi, y  sobre los sentimientos y experiencias de la propia Anne y sus  acompañantes. Anne murió en el campo  de Bergen-Belsen en marzo de 1945. Su Diario nunca morirá. «De entre los muchos que, a lo largo de la historia, han hablado en  nombre de la dignidad humana en tiempos de sufrimiento y muerte, no hay ninguna voz que tenga más peso que la de Anne Frank.» John F. En ese lugar y en las m&aacute;s precarias condiciones, Anne, a la saz&oacute;n una ni&ntilde;a de trece a&ntilde;os, escribi&oacute; su estremecedor Diario:  un testimonio &uacute;nico en su g&eacute;nero sobre el horror y la barbarie nazi, y  sobre los sentimientos y experiencias de la propia Anne y sus  acompa&ntilde;antes.                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/177804/laura-prats">Laura Prats</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Random House Grupo Editorial</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">January 2017</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">12 hours 27 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                        <h4 class="book-language">Language: <span class="nobold">Spanish</span></h4>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Un testimonio \xc3\xbanico sobre el horror y la barbarie nazi, y sobre los  sentimientos y experiencias que vivi\xc3\xb3 una ni\xc3\xb1a jud\xc3\xada recluida con su familia para huir del Holocausto, ahora en audiolibro.<br />\r\n Tras la invasi\xc3\xb3n de Holanda, los Frank, comerciantes jud\xc3\xados alemanes  emigrados a Amsterdam en 1933, se ocultaron de la Gestapo en una  buhardilla anexa al edificio donde el padre de Anne ten\xc3\xada sus oficinas.  Eran ocho personas y permanecieron recluidas desde junio de 1942 hasta  agosto de 1944, fecha en que fueron detenidas y enviadas a campos de concentraci\xc3\xb3n. En ese lugar y en las m\xc3\xa1s precarias condiciones, Anne, a la saz\xc3\xb3n una ni\xc3\xb1a de trece a\xc3\xb1os, escribi\xc3\xb3 su estremecedor Diario:  un testimonio \xc3\xbanico en su g\xc3\xa9nero sobre el horror y la barbarie nazi, y  sobre los sentimientos y experiencias de la propia Anne y sus  acompa\xc3\xb1antes. Anne muri\xc3\xb3 en el campo  de Bergen-Belsen en marzo de 1945. Su Diario nunca morir\xc3\xa1.<br />\r\n \xc2\xabDe entre los muchos que, a lo largo de la historia, han hablado en  nombre de la dignidad humana en tiempos de sufrimiento y muerte, no hay ninguna voz que tenga m\xc3\xa1s peso que la de Anne Frank.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nJohn F. Kennedy</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir" genre-id="14"><span itemprop="title">Biography & Memoir</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir/general" genre-id="450"><span itemprop="title">General</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div class="line"></div>\r\n\r\n                    <!-- Similar Titles and Also Customers Bought Tab Widget -->\r\n                    <div                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/26795/susan-adams">Susan Adams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Authors Republic</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">July 2019</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">8 hours 59 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Anne Frank, it has been said, gave a face and a name to the horror of the Holocaust. This is her story. It relates how Anne, her family, and their friends hid in secret rooms-\'the Annex\'-in an Amsterdam warehouse for 25 months. Anne, just 13 when the family moved in and only 15 when the Gestapo at last broke down the doors of her secret world, found hope where there was only fear and the first blush of love when outside and all around there washed a sea of hate.  Wrote Ernst Schnable, a German writer who has researched Frank\'s life: \'Out of the millions that were silenced, this voice no louder than a child\'s whisper has outlasted the shouts of the murderers and has soared above the voices of time.\'</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/kids" genre-id="255"><span itemprop="title">Kids</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/kids/historical" genre-id="477"><span itemprop="title">Historical</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. options.data == \'object\'){\n                    options.data[\'formy_form_token\'] = "7c944379af0ad2aabbeaadeeb54e34e5";\n                }\n                else{\n                    options.data += "&formy_form_token=7c944379af0ad2aabbeaadeeb54e34e5";\n                }\n\n            }\n            return _oldAjax(options);\n        };\n    })();\n\n    $(document).ready(function(){\n        var selector = $(\'form[method="post"]\');\n        if(selector.on){\n            selector.on(\'submit\', function(){\n                $(\'<input />\').attr(\'type\', \'hidden\')\n                    .attr(\'name\', "formy_form_token")\n                    .attr(\'value\', "7c944379af0ad2aabbeaadeeb54e34e5")\n                    .appendTo(this);\n                return true;\n            })\n <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/229539/fritzi-haberlandt">Fritzi Haberlandt</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Argon Verlag GmbH</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4                         <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">10 hours 33 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                        <h4 class="book-language">Language: <span class="nobold">German</span></h4>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">\'Zwischen Sonntagmorgen und jetzt scheinen Jahre zu liegen. Es ist so viel geschehen, als h\xc3\xa4tte sich pl\xc3\xb6tzlich die Welt umgedreht.\'<br />\nF\xc3\xbcr Anne Frank war ihr Tagebuch in der Enge des Verstecks Ersatz f\xc3\xbcr eine Freundin und Gespr\xc3\xa4chspartnerin, Ventil f\xc3\xbcr Sorgen und Unmutsausbr\xc3\xbcche, zugleich \xc3\x9cbungsfeld f\xc3\xbcr ihre schriftstellerischen Talente. F\xc3\xbcr uns ist und bleibt es das eindringlichste und bewegendste Dokument der Judenverfolgung im Nationalsozialismus.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/26795/susan-adams">Susan Adams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Authors Republic</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">July 2019</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">8 hours 59 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Anne Frank, it has been said, gave a face and a name to the horror of the Holocaust. This is her story. It relates how Anne, her family, and their friends hid in secret rooms-\'the Annex\'-in an Amsterdam warehouse for 25 months. Anne, just 13 when the family moved in and only 15 when the Gestapo at last broke down the doors of her secret world, found hope where there was only fear and the first blush of love when outside and all around there washed a sea of hate.  Wrote Ernst Schnable, a German writer who has researched Frank\'s life: \'Out of the millions that were silenced, this voice no louder than a child\'s whisper has outlasted the shouts of the murderers and has soared above the voices of time.\'</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/kids" genre-id="255"><span itemprop="title">Kids</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/kids/historical" genre-id="477"><span itemprop="title">Historical</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div class="line"></div>\r\n\r\n                    <!-- Similar Titles and Also Customers Bought Tab Widget -->\r\n                    <div class="tab_widget" Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. Eran ocho personas y permanecieron recluidas desde junio de 1942 hasta  agosto de 1944, fecha en que fueron detenidas y enviadas a campos de concentraci&oacute;n. En ese lugar y en las m&aacute;s precarias condiciones, Anne, a la saz&oacute;n una ni&ntilde;a de trece a&ntilde;os, escribi&oacute; su estremecedor Diario:  un testimonio &uacute;nico en su g&eacute;nero sobre el horror y la barbarie nazi, y  sobre los sentimientos y experiencias de la propia Anne y sus  acompa&ntilde;antes. Anne muri&oacute; en el campo  de Bergen-Belsen en marzo de 1945. Su Diario nunca morir&aacute;.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n &laquo;De entre los muchos que, a lo largo de la historia, han hablado en  nombre de la dignidad humana en tiempos de sufrimiento y muerte, no hay ninguna voz que tenga m&aacute;s peso que la de Anne Frank.&raquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nJohn F.                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/177804/laura-prats">Laura Prats</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Penguin Random House Grupo Editorial</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">January 2017</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">12 hours 27 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                        <h4 class="book-language">Language: <span class="nobold">Spanish</span></h4>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Un testimonio \xc3\xbanico sobre el horror y la barbarie nazi, y sobre los  sentimientos y experiencias que vivi\xc3\xb3 una ni\xc3\xb1a jud\xc3\xada recluida con su familia para huir del Holocausto, ahora en audiolibro.<br />\r\n Tras la invasi\xc3\xb3n de Holanda, los Frank, comerciantes jud\xc3\xados alemanes  emigrados a Amsterdam en 1933, se ocultaron de la Gestapo en una  buhardilla anexa al edificio donde el padre de Anne ten\xc3\xada sus oficinas.  Eran ocho personas y permanecieron recluidas desde junio de 1942 hasta  agosto de 1944, fecha en que fueron detenidas y enviadas a campos de concentraci\xc3\xb3n. En ese lugar y en las m\xc3\xa1s precarias condiciones, Anne, a la saz\xc3\xb3n una ni\xc3\xb1a de trece a\xc3\xb1os, escribi\xc3\xb3 su estremecedor Diario:  un testimonio \xc3\xbanico en su g\xc3\xa9nero sobre el horror y la barbarie nazi, y  sobre los sentimientos y experiencias de la propia Anne y sus  acompa\xc3\xb1antes. Anne muri\xc3\xb3 en el campo  de Bergen-Belsen en marzo de 1945. Su Diario nunca morir\xc3\xa1.<br />\r\n \xc2\xabDe entre los muchos que, a lo largo de la historia, han hablado en  nombre de la dignidad humana en tiempos de sufrimiento y muerte, no hay ninguna voz que tenga m\xc3\xa1s peso que la de Anne Frank.\xc2\xbb<br />\r\nJohn F. Kennedy</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir" genre-id="14"><span itemprop="title">Biography & Memoir</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir/general" genre-id="450"><span itemprop="title">General</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n               </div>\r\n                                                                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/229539/fritzi-haberlandt">Fritzi Haberlandt</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Argon Verlag GmbH</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">March 2016</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">10 hours 33 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                        <h4 class="book-language">Language: <span class="nobold">German</span></h4>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">\'Zwischen Sonntagmorgen und jetzt scheinen Jahre zu liegen. Es ist so viel geschehen, als h\xc3\xa4tte sich pl\xc3\xb6tzlich die Welt umgedreht.\'<br />\nF\xc3\xbcr Anne Frank war ihr Tagebuch in der Enge des Verstecks Ersatz f\xc3\xbcr eine Freundin und Gespr\xc3\xa4chspartnerin, Ventil f\xc3\xbcr Sorgen und Unmutsausbr\xc3\xbcche, zugleich \xc3\x9cbungsfeld f\xc3\xbcr ihre schriftstellerischen Talente. F\xc3\xbcr uns ist und bleibt es das eindringlichste und bewegendste Dokument der Judenverfolgung im Nationalsozialismus.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url"                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/26795/susan-adams">Susan Adams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">BN Publishing</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">January 2016</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">8 hours 59 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Anne Frank, it has been said, gave a face and a name to the horror of the Holocaust. This is her story. It relates how Anne, her family, and their friends hid in secret rooms - "the Annex" - in an Amsterdam warehouse for 25 months. Anne, just 13 when the family moved in and only 15 when the Gestapo at last broke down the doors of her secret world, found hope where there was only fear and the first blush of love when outside and all around there washed a sea of hate.<br />\n<br />\nWrote Ernst Schnable, a German writer who has researched Frank\'s life: "Out of the millions that were silenced, this voice no louder than a child\'s whisper has outlasted the shouts of the murderers and has soared above the voices of time."</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" genre-id="250"><span itemprop="title">History & Culture</split></a></div></div><div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_1"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir" genre-id="14"><span itemprop="title">Biography & Memoir</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" True, None], 0.7833333333333334], [['AUDIOBOOK', 'Anne Frank: The Diary of a Young Girl: The Definitive Edition', <PIL.Image.Image image mode=L size=344x399 at 0x213C2F10F08>, 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9780739368152.jpg', None, 'Discovered in the attic in which she spent the last years of her life, Anne Frank’s remarkable diary has since become a world classic—a powerful reminder of the horrors of war and an eloquent testament to the human spirit.\xa0 In 1942, with Nazis occupying Holland, a thirteen-year-old Jewish girl and her family fled their home in Amsterdam and went into hiding. For the next two years, until their whereabouts were betrayed to the Gestapo, they and another family lived cloistered in the “Secret Annex” of an old office building. Cut off from the outside world, they faced hunger, boredom, the constant cruelties of living in confined quarters, and the ever-present threat of discovery and death. In her diary Anne Frank recorded vivid impressions of her experiences during this period. By turns thoughtful, moving, and amusing, her account offers a fascinating commentary on human courage and frailty and a compelling self-portrait of a sensitive and spirited young woman whose promise was tragically cut short. Praise for\xa0The Diary of a Young Girl “A truly remarkable book.”—The New York Times “One of the most moving personal documents to come out of World War II.”—The Philadelphia Inquirer “There may be no better way to commemorate the fiftieth\xa0anniversary of the end of World War II than to\xa0reread\xa0The Diary of a Young Girl,\xa0a testament to an indestructible nobility of\xa0spirit in the For the next two years, until their whereabouts were betrayed to the Gestapo, they and another family lived cloistered in the &amp;ldquo;Secret Annex&amp;rdquo; of an old office building. Cut off from the outside world, they faced hunger, boredom, the constant cruelties of living in confined quarters, and the ever-present threat of discovery and death. In her diary Anne Frank recorded vivid impressions of her experiences during this period. By turns thoughtful, moving, and amusing, her account offers a fascinating commentary on human courage and frailty and a compelling self-portrait of a sensitive and spirited young woman whose promise was tragically cut short.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nPraise for&amp;#160;The Diary of a Young Girl&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;A truly remarkable book.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;The New York Times&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;One of the most moving personal documents to come out of World War II.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;The Philadelphia Inquirer&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;There may be no better way to commemorate the fiftieth&amp;#160;anniversary of the end of World War II than to&amp;#160;reread&amp;#160;The Diary of a Young Girl,&amp;#160;a testament to an indestructible nobility of&amp;#160;spirit in the face of pure&amp;#160;evil.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;Chicago Tribune&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;The single most compelling personal account of the Holocaust . . . remains astonishing and excruciating.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;The New York Times Book Review&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;How brilliantly Anne Frank     </div>\r\n                                                                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/27151/selma-blair">Selma Blair</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Listening Library (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">May 2010</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">9 hours 55 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Discovered in the attic in which she spent the last years of her life, Anne Frank&rsquo;s remarkable diary has since become a world classic&mdash;a powerful reminder of the horrors of war and an eloquent testament to the human spirit.&#160;<br />\r\n<br />\r\nIn 1942, with Nazis occupying Holland, a thirteen-year-old Jewish girl and her family fled their home in Amsterdam and went into hiding. For the next two years, until their whereabouts were betrayed to the Gestapo, they and another family lived cloistered in the &ldquo;Secret Annex&rdquo; of an old office building. Cut off from the outside world, they faced hunger, boredom, the constant cruelties of living in confined quarters, and the ever-present threat of discovery and death. In her diary Anne Frank recorded vivid impressions of her experiences during this period. By turns thoughtful, moving, and amusing, her account offers a fascinating commentary on human courage and frailty and a compelling self-portrait of a sensitive and spirited young woman whose promise was tragically cut short.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for&#160;The Diary of a Young Girl<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;A truly remarkable book.&rdquo;&mdash;The New York Times<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;One of the most moving personal documents to come out of World War II.&rdquo;&mdash;The Philadelphia Inquirer<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;There may be no better way to commemorate the fiftieth&#160;anniversary of the end of World War II than to&#160;reread&#160;The Diary of a Young Girl,&#160;a testament to an indestructible nobility of&#160;spirit in the face of pure&#160;evil.&rdquo;&mdash;Chicago Tribune<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;The single most compelling personal account of the Holocaust . . . remains astonishing and excruciating.&rdquo;&mdash;The New York Times Book Review<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;How brilliantly Anne Frank captures the self-conscious alienation and&#160;na&iuml;ve self-absorption of adolescence.&rdquo;&mdash;Newsday</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir" genre-id="14"><span itemprop="title">Biography & Memoir</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir/history_and_culture" genre-id="250"><span itemprop="title">History & Culture</split></a></div></div><div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_1"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/history" genre-id="6"><span itemprop="title">History</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/history/world" genre-id="83"><span itemprop="title">World</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div class="line"></div>\r\n\r\n                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Brittany H</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">Loved this book!!! I have read and listen to this book growing up and it never gets old </p>\r\n                                                <p class="tright nomargin review-helpfulness">1 of 2 people found this review helpful.</p>                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Brian H.</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">What an experience/life for such a young girl. I am always astonished at how intelligent of a person she was and how horrible a period of time. I wonder how she would have impacted the world if the outcome was different.\n\nUnforgettable.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                </ul>\r\n                            </div>\r\n                            <div id="tab-social" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: none;">Donec in tortor in lectus iaculis vulputate. Sed aliquam, urna ut sollicitudin molestie, lacus justo aliquam mauris, interdum aliquam sapien nisi cursus mauris. Nunc hendrerit tortor vitae est placerat ut varius erat posuere. Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus.</div>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                    </div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\r\n                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/26795/susan-adams">Susan Adams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Findaway Voices</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">January 2018</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">8 hours 59 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Anne Frank, it has been said, gave a face and a name to the horror of the Holocaust. This is her story. It relates how Anne, her family, and their friends hid in secret rooms&mdash;\'the Annex\'&mdash;in an Amsterdam warehouse for 25 months. Anne, just 13 when the family moved in and only 15 when the Gestapo at last broke down the doors of her secret world, found hope where there was only fear and the first blush of love when outside and all around there washed a sea of hate.<br />\r\nWrote Ernst Schnable, a German writer who has researched Frank\'s life: \'Out of the millions that were silenced, this voice no louder than a child\'s whisper has outlasted the shouts of the murderers and has soared above the voices of time.\'</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir" genre-id="14"><span itemprop="title">Biography & Memoir</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir/history_and_culture" genre-id="250"><span itemprop="title">History & Culture</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n .attr(\'name\', "formy_form_token")\n                    .attr(\'value\', "3a33fca8c403f0a99be74fc1418bdb3d")\n                    .appendTo(this);\n                return true;\n            })\n                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/26795/susan-adams">Susan Adams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Findaway Voices</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">January 2018</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">8 hours 59 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Anne Frank, it has been said, gave a face and a name to the horror of the Holocaust. This is her story. It relates how Anne, her family, and their friends hid in secret rooms&mdash;\'the Annex\'&mdash;in an Amsterdam warehouse for 25 months. Anne, just 13 when the family moved in and only 15 when the Gestapo at last broke down the doors of her secret world, found hope where there was only fear and the first blush of love when outside and all around there washed a sea of hate.<br />\r\nWrote Ernst Schnable, a German writer who has researched Frank\'s life: \'Out of the millions that were silenced, this voice no louder than a child\'s whisper has outlasted the shouts of the murderers and has soared above the voices of time.\'</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir"                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/26795/susan-adams">Susan Adams</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">BN Publishing</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">January 2016</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">8 hours 59 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Anne Frank, it has been said, gave a face and a name to the horror of the Holocaust. This is her story. It relates how Anne, her family, and their friends hid in secret rooms - "the Annex" - in an Amsterdam warehouse for 25 months. Anne, just 13 when the family moved in and only 15 when the Gestapo at last broke down the doors of her secret world, found hope where there was only fear and the first blush of love when outside and all around there washed a sea of hate.<br />\n<br />\nWrote Ernst Schnable, a German writer who has researched Frank\'s life: "Out of the millions that were silenced, this voice no louder than a child\'s whisper has outlasted the shouts of the murderers and has soared above the voices of time."</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper.                             });\r\n                            } ,750);\r\n                        }\r\n                        else {\r\n 'https://covers.audiobooks.com/images/covers/full/9780739368152.jpg', None, 'Discovered in the attic in which she spent the last years of her life, Anne Frank’s remarkable diary has since become a world classic—a powerful reminder of the horrors of war and an eloquent testament to the human spirit.\xa0 In 1942, with Nazis occupying Holland, a thirteen-year-old Jewish girl and her family fled their home in Amsterdam and went into hiding. For the next two years, until their whereabouts were betrayed to the Gestapo, they and another family lived cloistered in the “Secret Annex” of an old office building. Cut off from the outside world, they faced hunger, boredom, the constant cruelties of living in confined quarters, and the ever-present threat of discovery and death. In her diary Anne Frank recorded vivid impressions of her experiences during this period. By turns thoughtful, moving, and amusing, her account offers a fascinating commentary on human courage and frailty and a compelling self-portrait of a sensitive and spirited young woman whose promise was tragically cut short. For the next two years, until their whereabouts were betrayed to the Gestapo, they and another family lived cloistered in the &amp;ldquo;Secret Annex&amp;rdquo; of an old office building. Cut off from the outside world, they faced hunger, boredom, the constant cruelties of living in confined quarters, and the ever-present threat of discovery and death. In her diary Anne Frank recorded vivid impressions of her experiences during this period. By turns thoughtful, moving, and amusing, her account offers a fascinating commentary on human courage and frailty and a compelling self-portrait of a sensitive and spirited young woman whose promise was tragically cut short.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nPraise for&amp;#160;The Diary of a Young Girl&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;ldquo;A truly remarkable book.&amp;rdquo;&amp;mdash;The New     </div>\r\n                                                                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/27151/selma-blair">Selma Blair</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Listening Library (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">May 2010</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">9 hours 55 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Discovered in the attic in which she spent the last years of her life, Anne Frank&rsquo;s remarkable diary has since become a world classic&mdash;a powerful reminder of the horrors of war and an eloquent testament to the human spirit.&#160;<br />\r\n<br />\r\nIn 1942, with Nazis occupying Holland, a thirteen-year-old Jewish girl and her family fled their home in Amsterdam and went into hiding. For the next two years, until their whereabouts were betrayed to the Gestapo, they and another family lived cloistered in the &ldquo;Secret Annex&rdquo; of an old office building. Cut off from the outside world, they faced hunger, boredom, the constant cruelties of living in confined quarters, and the ever-present threat of discovery and death. In her diary Anne Frank recorded vivid impressions of her experiences during this period. By turns thoughtful, moving, and amusing, her account offers a fascinating commentary on human courage and frailty and a compelling self-portrait of a sensitive and spirited young woman whose promise was tragically cut short.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nPraise for&#160;The Diary of a Young Girl<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;A truly remarkable book.&rdquo;&mdash;The New York Times<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;One of the most moving personal documents to come out of World War II.&rdquo;&mdash;The Philadelphia Inquirer<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;There may be no better way to commemorate the fiftieth&#160;anniversary of the end of World War II than to&#160;reread&#160;The Diary of a Young Girl,&#160;a testament to an indestructible nobility of&#160;spirit in the face of pure&#160;evil.&rdquo;&mdash;Chicago Tribune<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;The single most compelling personal account of the Holocaust . . . remains astonishing and excruciating.&rdquo;&mdash;The New York Times Book Review<br />\r\n<br />\r\n&ldquo;How brilliantly Anne Frank captures the self-conscious alienation and&#160;na&iuml;ve self-absorption of adolescence.&rdquo;&mdash;Newsday</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir" genre-id="14"><span itemprop="title">Biography & Memoir</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir/history_and_culture" genre-id="250"><span itemprop="title">History & Culture</split></a></div></div><div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_1"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/history" genre-id="6"><span itemprop="title">History</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/history/world" genre-id="83"><span itemprop="title">World</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div class="line"></div>\r\n\r\n class="book-rating-description nomargin">Loved this book!!! I have read and listen to this book growing up and it never gets old </p>\r\n                                                <p class="tright nomargin review-helpfulness">1 of 2 people found this review helpful.</p>                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Brian H.</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">What an experience/life for such a young girl. I am always astonished at how intelligent of a person she was and how horrible a period of time. I wonder how she would have impacted the world if the outcome was different.\n\nUnforgettable.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                </ul>\r\n                            </div>\r\n                            <div id="tab-social" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: none;">Donec in tortor in lectus iaculis vulputate. Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. become an everlasting source of courage and inspiration. Hiding from the Nazis in the “Secret Annex” of an old office building in Amsterdam, a thirteen-year-old girl named Anne Frank became a writer. The now famous diary of her private life and thoughts reveals only part of Anne’s story, however. This book rounds out the portrait of this remarkable and talented young author. Newly translated, complete, and restored to the original order in which Anne herself wrote them in her notebook, Tales from the Secret Annex is a collection of Anne Frank’s lesser-known writings: short stories, fables, personal reminiscences, and an unfinished novel, Cady’s Life.                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/2126/kathe-mazur">Kathe Mazur</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Listening Library (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">March 2010</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">5 hours 28 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">The candid, poignant, unforgettable writing of the young girl whose own life story has become an everlasting source of courage and inspiration.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nHiding from the Nazis in the &#8220;Secret Annex&#8221; of an old office building in Amsterdam, a thirteen-year-old girl named Anne Frank became a writer. The now famous diary of her private life and thoughts reveals only part of Anne&#8217;s story, however. This book rounds out the portrait of this remarkable and talented young author.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nNewly translated, complete, and restored to the original order in which Anne herself wrote them in her notebook, Tales from the Secret Annex is a collection of Anne Frank&#8217;s lesser-known writings: short stories, fables, personal reminiscences, and an unfinished novel, Cady&#8217;s Life.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/fiction_and_literature" genre-id="15"><span itemprop="title">Fiction & Literature</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/fiction_and_literature/essays_and_anthologies" genre-id="101"><span itemprop="title">Essays & Anthologies</split></a></div></div><div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_1"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/history" genre-id="6"><span itemprop="title">History</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url"                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/2126/kathe-mazur">Kathe Mazur</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Listening Library (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">March 2010</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">5 hours 28 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">The candid, poignant, unforgettable writing of the young girl whose own life story has become an everlasting source of courage and inspiration.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nHiding from the Nazis in the &#8220;Secret Annex&#8221; of an old office building in Amsterdam, a thirteen-year-old girl named Anne Frank became a writer. The now famous diary of her private life and thoughts reveals only part of Anne&#8217;s story, however. This book rounds out the portrait of this remarkable and talented young author.<br />\r\n<br />\r\nNewly translated, complete, and restored to the original order in which Anne herself wrote them in her notebook, Tales from the Secret Annex is a collection of Anne Frank&#8217;s lesser-known writings: short stories, fables, personal reminiscences, and an unfinished novel, Cady&#8217;s Life.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/fiction_and_literature" genre-id="15"><span itemprop="title">Fiction & Literature</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/fiction_and_literature/essays_and_anthologies" genre-id="101"><span itemprop="title">Essays & Anthologies</split></a></div></div><div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_1"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/history" genre-id="6"><span itemprop="title">History</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/history/world" genre-id="83"><span itemprop="title">World</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n Anne Frank était l'une de ces enfants. A 4 ans, Anne Frank et sa famille fuient l'Allemagne nazie pour les Pays-Bas. L'insouciante jeune fille entreprend l'écriture d'un journal intime, le 12 juin 1942. Du haut de ses 13 ans, elle livre au monde l'un des témoignages les plus émouvants sur la Seconde Guerre mondiale. Les Nazis persécutent les juifs de Hollande. Plus de 110 000 seront déportés, 5 000 survivront. Aidés par des amis hollandais, le 6 juillet 1942, les Frank décident de se cacher dans l'annexe de l'entreprise paternelle. Le 4 août 1944, après deux ans de réclusion totale, ils sont dénoncés, arrêtés et déportés à Auschwitz, où Anne et sa soeur sont séparées de leurs parents, puis transférées au camp de Bergen-Belsen, près de Hanovre. Anne Frank meurt du typhus à 15 ans, quelques semaines seulement avant la fin de la guerre.  Après leur arrestation, Miep Gies, grande amie de la famille, retrouve le journal d'Anne Frank. Le père d'Anne, seul survivant des camps, met des mois avant de trouver le courage de lire les textes de sa fille, puis les fait publier. Anne Frank &eacute;tait l\'une de ces enfants. A 4 ans, Anne Frank et sa famille fuient l\'Allemagne nazie pour les Pays-Bas. L\'insouciante jeune fille entreprend l\'&eacute;criture d\'un journal intime, le 12 juin 1942. Du haut de ses 13 ans, elle livre au monde l\'un des t&eacute;moignages les plus &eacute;mouvants sur la Seconde Guerre mondiale. Les Nazis pers&eacute;cutent les juifs de Hollande. Plus de 110 000 seront d&eacute;port&eacute;s, 5 000 survivront. Aid&eacute;s par des amis hollandais, le 6 juillet 1942, les Frank d&eacute;cident de se cacher dans l\'annexe de l\'entreprise paternelle. Le 4 ao&ucirc;t 1944, apr&egrave;s deux ans de r&eacute;clusion totale, ils sont d&eacute;nonc&eacute;s, arr&ecirc;t&eacute;s et d&eacute;port&eacute;s &agrave; Auschwitz, o&ugrave; Anne et sa soeur sont s&eacute;par&eacute;es de leurs parents, puis transf&eacute;r&eacute;es au camp de Bergen-Belsen, pr&egrave;s de Hanovre. Anne Frank meurt du typhus &agrave; 15 ans, quelques semaines seulement avant la fin de la guerre. &lt;br /&gt;\nApr&egrave;s leur arrestation, Miep Gies, grande amie de la famille, retrouve le journal d\'Anne Frank. Le p&egrave;re d\'Anne, seul survivant des camps, met des mois avant de trouver le courage de lire les textes de sa fille, puis les fait publier. D\'une maturit&eacute; et d\'une lucidit&eacute; extraordinaires pour une si jeune fille, cette \xc2\x9cuvre a &eacute;mu le monde entier."/>\n\t\n    \n\t<title>Listen to Le journal d\'Anne Frank by            <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/167782/pascale-audret">Pascale Audret</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Compagnie du Savoir</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">December 2011</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">0 hours 50 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Un million d\'enfants juifs sont morts dans les camps de concentration durant la Seconde Guerre Mondiale. Anne Frank \xc3\xa9tait l\'une de ces enfants. A 4 ans, Anne Frank et sa famille fuient l\'Allemagne nazie pour les Pays-Bas. L\'insouciante jeune fille entreprend l\'\xc3\xa9criture d\'un journal intime, le 12 juin 1942. Du haut de ses 13 ans, elle livre au monde l\'un des t\xc3\xa9moignages les plus \xc3\xa9mouvants sur la Seconde Guerre mondiale. Les Nazis pers\xc3\xa9cutent les juifs de Hollande. Plus de 110 000 seront d\xc3\xa9port\xc3\xa9s, 5 000 survivront. Aid\xc3\xa9s par des amis hollandais, le 6 juillet 1942, les Frank d\xc3\xa9cident de se cacher dans l\'annexe de l\'entreprise paternelle. Le 4 ao\xc3\xbbt 1944, apr\xc3\xa8s deux ans de r\xc3\xa9clusion totale, ils sont d\xc3\xa9nonc\xc3\xa9s, arr\xc3\xaat\xc3\xa9s et d\xc3\xa9port\xc3\xa9s \xc3\xa0 Auschwitz, o\xc3\xb9 Anne et sa soeur sont s\xc3\xa9par\xc3\xa9es de leurs parents, puis transf\xc3\xa9r\xc3\xa9es au camp de Bergen-Belsen, pr\xc3\xa8s de Hanovre. Anne Frank meurt du typhus \xc3\xa0 15 ans, quelques semaines seulement avant la fin de la guerre. <br />\nApr\xc3\xa8s leur arrestation, Miep Gies, grande amie de la famille, retrouve le journal d\'Anne Frank. Le p\xc3\xa8re d\'Anne, seul survivant des camps, met des mois avant de trouver le courage de lire les textes de sa fille, puis les fait publier. D\'une maturit\xc3\xa9 et d\'une lucidit\xc3\xa9 extraordinaires pour une si jeune fille, cette \xc2\x9cuvre a \xc3\xa9mu le monde entier.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url"            <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/8329/anne-frank">Anne Frank</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/167782/pascale-audret">Pascale Audret</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Compagnie du Savoir</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">December 2011</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">0 hours 50 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Un million d\'enfants juifs sont morts dans les camps de concentration durant la Seconde Guerre Mondiale. Anne Frank \xc3\xa9tait l\'une de ces enfants. A 4 ans, Anne Frank et sa famille fuient l\'Allemagne nazie pour les Pays-Bas. L\'insouciante jeune fille entreprend l\'\xc3\xa9criture d\'un journal intime, le 12 juin 1942. Du haut de ses 13 ans, elle livre au monde l\'un des t\xc3\xa9moignages les plus \xc3\xa9mouvants sur la Seconde Guerre mondiale. Les Nazis pers\xc3\xa9cutent les juifs de Hollande. Plus de 110 000 seront d\xc3\xa9port\xc3\xa9s, 5 000 survivront. Aid\xc3\xa9s par des amis hollandais, le 6 juillet 1942, les Frank d\xc3\xa9cident de se cacher dans l\'annexe de l\'entreprise paternelle. Le 4 ao\xc3\xbbt 1944, apr\xc3\xa8s deux ans de r\xc3\xa9clusion totale, ils sont d\xc3\xa9nonc\xc3\xa9s, arr\xc3\xaat\xc3\xa9s et d\xc3\xa9port\xc3\xa9s \xc3\xa0 Auschwitz, o\xc3\xb9 Anne et sa soeur sont s\xc3\xa9par\xc3\xa9es de leurs parents, puis transf\xc3\xa9r\xc3\xa9es au camp de Bergen-Belsen, pr\xc3\xa8s de Hanovre. Anne Frank meurt du typhus \xc3\xa0 15 ans, quelques semaines seulement avant la fin de la guerre. <br />\nApr\xc3\xa8s leur arrestation, Miep Gies, grande amie de la famille, retrouve le journal d\'Anne Frank. Le p\xc3\xa8re d\'Anne, seul survivant des camps, met des mois avant de trouver le courage de lire les textes de sa fille, puis les fait publier. D\'une maturit\xc3\xa9 et d\'une lucidit\xc3\xa9 extraordinaires pour une si jeune fille, cette \xc2\x9cuvre a \xc3\xa9mu le monde entier.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" itemprop="title">Other</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div class="line"></div>\r\n\r\n                                           <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Daniel K.</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="2"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">This book was not at all what I expected.  I was hoping for a story. Instead it\'s a play by play of a stage performance.  I really didn\'t need to know how the characters of the story move around the stage.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                </ul>\r\n                            </div>\r\n                            <div id="tab-social" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: none;">Donec in tortor in lectus iaculis vulputate. Sed aliquam, urna ut sollicitudin molestie, lacus justo aliquam mauris, interdum aliquam sapien nisi cursus mauris. Nunc hendrerit tortor vitae est placerat ut varius erat posuere. Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus.</div>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                    </div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\r\n                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/25524/alison-leslie-gold">Alison Leslie Gold</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/25523/miep-gies">Miep Gies</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/478/barbara-rosenblat">Barbara Rosenblat</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Oasis Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">February 2009</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">9 hours 11 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">She found Anne Frank\'s diary and brought the world a message of love and hope.&#160; For more than two years, Miep Gies and her husband helped hide the Franks from the Nazis. Like thousands of unsung heroes of the Holocaust, they risked their lives each day to bring food, news, and emotional support to the victims. From her own remarkable childhood as a World War I refugee to the moment she places a small, red-orange, checkered diary -- Anne\'s legacy -- in Otto Frank\'s hands, Miep Gies remembers her days with simple honesty and shattering clarity. Each page rings with courage and heartbreaking beauty.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir" genre-id="14"><span itemprop="title">Biography & Memoir</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir/history_and_culture" genre-id="250"><span itemprop="title">History & Culture</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n Like thousands of unsung heroes of the Holocaust, they risked their lives each day to bring food, news, and emotional support to the victims. From her own remarkable childhood as a World War I refugee to the moment she places a small, red-orange, checkered diary -- Anne\'s legacy -- in Otto Frank\'s hands, Miep Gies remembers her days with simple honesty and shattering clarity.                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/25524/alison-leslie-gold">Alison Leslie Gold</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/25523/miep-gies">Miep Gies</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/478/barbara-rosenblat">Barbara Rosenblat</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Oasis Audio</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">February 2009</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">9 hours 11 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">She found Anne Frank\'s diary and brought the world a message of love and hope.&#160; For more than two years, Miep Gies and her husband helped hide the Franks from the Nazis. Like thousands of unsung heroes of the Holocaust, they risked their lives each day to bring food, news, and emotional support to the victims. From her own remarkable childhood as a World War I refugee to the moment she places a small, red-orange, checkered diary -- Anne\'s legacy -- in Otto Frank\'s hands, Miep Gies remembers her days with simple honesty and shattering clarity. Each page rings with courage and heartbreaking beauty.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir" genre-id="14"><span itemprop="title">Biography & Memoir</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/biography_and_memoir/history_and_culture" genre-id="250"><span itemprop="title">History & Culture</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Daniel K.</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="2"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">This book was not at all what I expected.  I was hoping for a story. Instead it\'s a play by play of a stage performance.  I really didn\'t need to know how the characters of the story move around the stage.</p>\r\n                                                                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                </ul>\r\n                            </div>\r\n                            <div id="tab-social" class="tab_content clearfix" style="display: none;">Donec in tortor in lectus iaculis vulputate. Sed aliquam, urna ut sollicitudin molestie, lacus justo aliquam mauris, interdum aliquam sapien nisi cursus mauris. Nunc hendrerit tortor vitae est placerat ut varius erat posuere. Duis ut nisl in mi eleifend faucibus egestas aliquet arcu. Nam id enim sapien. Nam interdum justo eget nisi pulvinar et condimentum orci bibendum. Integer elementum tempor libero sit amet iaculis. Donec scelerisque, urna id tincidunt ultrices, nisi nisl lacinia mi, at pellentesque enim mi eu felis. Nullam malesuada egestas tincidunt. Pellentesque nec risus dui. Fusce sed nibh eu odio posuere semper. Etiam pulvinar, mi et molestie vestibulum, neque tellus pulvinar massa, vel varius nulla tellus at tortor. Sed at augue sit amet ipsum viverra ullamcorper. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus.</div>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                    </div>\r\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\r\n
