In the spring of 1959, The Diary of Anne Frank has just come to the silver screen to great acclaim, and a young woman named Margie Franklin is working in Philadelphia as a secretary at a Jewish law firm. On the surface she lives a quiet life, but Margie has a secret: a life she once lived, a past and a religion she has denied, and a family and a country she left behind. Margie Franklin is really Margot Frank, older sister of Anne, who did not die in Bergen-Belsen as reported, but who instead escaped the Nazis for America. But now, as her sister becomes a global icon, Margie\' s carefully constructed American life begins to fall apart. A new relationship threatens to overtake the young love that sustained her during the war, and her past and present begin to collide. Margie is forced to come to terms with Margot, with the people she loved, and with a life swept up into the course of history."/>\n\t\n    \n\t<title>Listen to Margot by Jillian Cantor at            <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/107629/jillian-cantor">Jillian Cantor</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/20740/rachel-botchan">Rachel Botchan</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Recorded Books</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">January 2014</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">10 hours 1 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">Anne Frank has long been a symbol of bravery and hope, but there were two sisters hidden in the annex, two young Jewish girls, one a cultural icon made famous by her published diary and the other, nearly forgotten. In the spring of 1959, The Diary of Anne Frank has just come to the silver screen to great acclaim, and a young woman named Margie Franklin is working in Philadelphia as a secretary at a Jewish law firm. On the surface she lives a quiet life, but Margie has a secret: a life she once lived, a past and a religion she has denied, and a family and a country she left behind. Margie Franklin is really Margot Frank, older sister of Anne, who did not die in Bergen-Belsen as reported, but who instead escaped the Nazis for America. But now, as her sister becomes a global icon, Margie\' s carefully constructed American life begins to fall apart. A new relationship threatens to overtake the young love that sustained her during the war, and her past and present begin to collide. Margie is forced to come to terms with Margot, with the people she loved, and with a life swept up into the course of history.</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/literature/literary_fiction" genre-id="103"><span itemprop="title">Literary Fiction</split></a></div></div></h4>\r\n                        <!-- <h4>Tags:</h4> -->\r\n                    </div>\r\n                    <div class="line"></div>\r\n\r\n group of students and the teacher who inspired them, featuring updates on the students’ lives, new journal entries, and an introduction by Erin Gruwell \xa0 Now a public television documentary,\xa0Freedom Writers: Stories from the Heart \xa0 In 1994, an idealistic first-year teacher in Long Beach, California, named Erin Gruwell confronted a room of “unteachable, at-risk” students. She had intercepted a note with an ugly racial caricature and angrily declared that this was precisely the sort of thing that led to the Holocaust. She was met by uncomprehending looks—none of her students had heard of one of the defining moments of the twentieth century. So she rebooted her entire curriculum, using treasured books such as Anne Frank’s diary as her guide to combat intolerance and misunderstanding. Her students began recording their thoughts and feelings in their own diaries, eventually dubbing themselves the “Freedom Writers.” \xa0 Consisting of powerful entries from the students’ diaries and narrative text by Erin Gruwell,\xa0The Freedom Writers Diary\xa0is an unforgettable story of how hard work, courage, and determination changed the lives of a teacher and her students. In the two decades since its original publication, the book has sold more than one million copies and inspired a major motion picture\xa0Freedom Writers. And now, with this twentieth-anniversary edition, readers are brought up to date on the lives of the Freedom Writers, as they blend indispensable takes on social issues with uplifting stories of attending college—and watch their own children follow in their footsteps.\xa0The Freedom Writers Diary\xa0remains a vital read for anyone who believes in second chances. She had intercepted a note with an ugly racial caricature and angrily declared that this was precisely the sort of thing that led to the Holocaust. She was met by uncomprehending looks&amp;mdash;none of her students had heard of one of the defining moments of the twentieth century. So she rebooted her entire curriculum, using treasured books such as Anne Frank&amp;rsquo;s diary as her guide to combat intolerance and misunderstanding. Her students began recording their thoughts and feelings in their own diaries, eventually dubbing themselves the &amp;ldquo;Freedom Writers.&amp;rdquo;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;#160;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nConsisting of powerful entries from the students&amp;rsquo; diaries and narrative text by Erin Gruwell,&amp;#160;The Freedom Writers Diary&amp;#160;is an unforgettable story of how hard work, courage, and determination changed the lives of a teacher and her students. In the two decades since its original publication, the book has sold more than one million copies and inspired a major motion picture&amp;#160;Freedom Writers. And now, with this twentieth-anniversary edition, readers are brought up to date on the lives of the Freedom Writers, as they blend indispensable takes on social issues with uplifting stories of attending college&amp;mdash;and watch their own children follow in their footsteps.&amp;#160;The Freedom Writers Diary&amp;#160;remains a vital read for anyone who believes in second chances."/>\n\t\n                                                                   <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/54672/erin-gruwell">Erin Gruwell</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/7920/cassandra-campbell">Cassandra Campbell</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/13903/dominic-hoffman">Dominic Hoffman</a></span>, <span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/16629/bahni-turpin">Bahni Turpin</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Random House (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">January 2006</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">9 hours 34 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">#1 NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER &bull;&#160;The twentieth anniversary edition of the classic story of an incredible group of students and the teacher who inspired them, featuring updates on the students&rsquo; lives, new journal entries, and an introduction by Erin Gruwell<br />\r\n&#160;<br />\r\nNow a public television documentary,&#160;Freedom Writers: Stories from the Heart<br />\r\n&#160;<br />\r\nIn 1994, an idealistic first-year teacher in Long Beach, California, named Erin Gruwell confronted a room of &ldquo;unteachable, at-risk&rdquo; students. She had intercepted a note with an ugly racial caricature and angrily declared that this was precisely the sort of thing that led to the Holocaust. She was met by uncomprehending looks&mdash;none of her students had heard of one of the defining moments of the twentieth century. So she rebooted her entire curriculum, using treasured books such as Anne Frank&rsquo;s diary as her guide to combat intolerance and misunderstanding. Her students began recording their thoughts and feelings in their own diaries, eventually dubbing themselves the &ldquo;Freedom Writers.&rdquo;<br />\r\n&#160;<br />\r\nConsisting of powerful entries from the students&rsquo; diaries and narrative text by Erin Gruwell,&#160;The Freedom Writers Diary&#160;is an unforgettable story of how hard work, courage, and determination changed the lives of a teacher and her students. In the two decades since its original publication, the book has sold more than one million copies and inspired a major motion picture&#160;Freedom Writers. And now, with this twentieth-anniversary edition, readers are brought up to date on the lives of the Freedom Writers, as they blend indispensable takes on social issues with uplifting stories of attending college&mdash;and watch their own children follow in their footsteps.&#160;The Freedom Writers Diary&#160;remains a vital read for anyone who believes in second chances.</p>\r\n                                                          <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-written-by">Written By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/author/15658/markus-zusak">Markus Zusak</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-narrated-by">Narrated By: <span class="nobold"><span class="no-margin-bottom bold"><a href="/browse/narrator/375/allan-corduner">Allan Corduner</a></span></span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-by">Publisher: <span class="nobold">Listening Library (Audio)</span></h4>\r\n                            <h4 class="book-published-date">Date: <span class="nobold">September 2006</span></h4>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                        <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                            <h4 class="book-duration">Duration: <span class="nobold">13 hours 57 minutes</span></h4>\r\n                                                                                </div>\r\n                        <h4 class="book-summary nopadding">Summary:</h4>\r\n                        <div class="book-description">\r\n                            <p class="hide">DON&rsquo;T MISS BRIDGE OF CLAY, MARKUS ZUSAK&rsquo;S FIRST NOVEL SINCE THE BOOK THIEF.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\nThe extraordinary #1&#160;New York Times&#160;bestseller that is now a major motion picture, Markus Zusak\'s unforgettable story is about the ability of books to feed the soul.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\nNominated as one of America\'s best-loved novels by&#160;PBS&rsquo;s&#160;The Great American Read.  <br />\r\n<br />\r\nWhen Death has a story to tell, you listen.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n It is 1939. Nazi Germany. The country is holding its breath. Death has never been busier, and will become busier still.<br />\r\n<br />\r\n Liesel Meminger is a foster girl living outside of Munich, who scratches out a meager existence for herself by stealing when she encounters something she can&rsquo;t resist&ndash;books. With the help of her accordion-playing foster father, she learns to read and shares her stolen books with her neighbors during bombing raids as well as with the Jewish man hidden in her basement.&#160;<br />\r\n<br />\r\n In superbly crafted writing that burns with intensity, award-winning author Markus Zusak, author of&#160;I Am the Messenger,&#160;has given us one of the most enduring stories of our time.<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;The kind of book that can be life-changing.&rdquo; &mdash;The New York Times<br />\r\n &#160;<br />\r\n &ldquo;Deserves a place on the same shelf with The Diary of a Young Girl by Anne Frank.&rdquo; &mdash;USA Today</p>\r\n                        </div>\r\n                                                <h4>Genres: <div itemscope itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" class="no-margin-bottom nobold" id="genre_0"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url" href="https://www.audiobooks.com/browse/teen" genre-id="254"><span itemprop="title">Teen</split></a> &gt; <div itemscope itemprop="child" itemtype="http://data-vocabulary.org/Breadcrumb" style="display:inline;"><a class="nobold" itemprop="url"                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">This is the most amazing book! It is written flawlessly and the narration adds a whole new feel to the story! I have listened to this countless times and it never gets old! A</p>\r\n                                                <p class="tright nomargin review-helpfulness">3 of 3 people found this review helpful.</p>                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Jason J.</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">I loved this book. I am not a big fan of revisionist history but this is different. It is adding to our understanding of the \xe2\x80\x9cenemy\xe2\x80\x9d in those days. This book is adolescent at times, even elementary, but that abandonment of conventions is brilliant. A book should be delivered to the reader in a manner that opens there mind without requiring a PhD to catch up.</p>\r\n                                                <p class="tright nomargin review-helpfulness">3 of 3 people found this review helpful.</p>                                            </div>\r\n                                    \t</li>\r\n                                \t                                \t\t<li class="clearfix">\r\n                                            <div class="spost-content clearfix">\r\n                                                <div class="user-reviews">\r\n                                                    <div class="clearfix">\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <h5 class="nopadding">Robert E.</h5>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                        <div class="fleft">\r\n                                                            <span class="book-rating" data-score="5"></span>\r\n                                                        </div>\r\n                                                    </div>\r\n                                                </div>\r\n                                                <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">I loved the book.         <p class="book-rating-description nomargin">I don\'t know what I was expecting but it wasn\'t this book.  It took me a bit to get into ... then I did.  Excellent writing!  Excellent narration!  Terrific story!  I felt as if I were there as the story unfolded.  A different view of Germany during WWII.
